meanings.sent1: The robot's face remained inexpressive, never revealing any emotion.
meanings.sent2: Her inexpressive demeanor made it hard to understand how she truly felt.
meanings.sent3: Even the clown's inexpressive mask couldn't hide his excitement.
meanings.sent4: The painting's inexpressive eyes seemed to follow you around the room.
meanings.sent5: The inexpressive sky mirrored his somber mood perfectly.

meanings.sent1: The inexpressive response left everyone unsure of what to do next.
meanings.sent2: His inexpressive writing style made it difficult to connect with his audience.
meanings.sent3: The inexpressive radio broadcast left listeners confused and frustrated.
meanings.sent4: The inexpressive landscape failed to capture the beauty of the countryside.
meanings.sent5: Her inexpressive gestures made it hard for others to understand her intentions.

meanings.definition: Unable to convey thoughts or emotions through words or actions
meanings.sent1: His inexpressive speech made it challenging to communicate his ideas effectively.
meanings.sent2: The inexpressive performance left the audience feeling disconnected.
meanings.sent3: The inexpressive mime struggled to convey his message without words.
meanings.sent4: Her inexpressive body language failed to express her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The inexpressive silence in the room spoke volumes about their relationship.
